data.title: Fujitsu involved on the Artistic Gymnastics World Championships: embracing excellence in technology
data.meta_description: ü§∏ Fujitsu is the proud sponsor of the upcoming Artistic Gymnastics World Championships, set to take place in Antwerp, Belgium, from September 30th to October 8th. This globally renowned sporting event will bring together the world's most talented gymnasts for a breathtaking competition.
data.text:
Fujitsu's advanced technologies will play a crucial role in its execution. Indeed, our expertise in technological solutions has been acknowledged, and we take great pride in providing the necessary tools to monitor and judge the athletes' performances with precision.

ü§ñüèÖAI is revolutionizing sports competitions, enhancing accuracy and fairness. AI-based VAR reduces refereeing errors. Sensors and cameras analyze athletes' performances, providing training insights. AI-powered image recognition tracks athletes and assesses rule compliance, as seen in gymnastics. These technologies make sports more equitable and transparent, enhancing the spectator experience and upholding sports' integrity. The convergence of sports and technology promises an exciting future, where continuous innovation reshapes the global sports landscape.

Here's an overview of some of the Fujitsu technologies being implemented for the World Championships:

JSS Demo with Pre-Captured Data: This technology will enable the analysis and comparison of gymnasts' performances using pre-recorded data, offering a unique perspective on their progress.

Body Core Assessment: Thanks to real-time angle measurements at various points on the body, we can assess the precision of gymnasts' movements and compare them to ideal forms.

Movement assessment based on ideal forms: Using sophisticated algorithms, we will be able to score athletes' movements based on how closely they align with ideal forms.

Vision AI-based technologies: Vision AI will play a key role in tracking gymnasts' routines, allowing for precise and real-time evaluation.

Real-Time Human Sensing: We will utilize real-time human sensing technologies to track athletes' movements, ensuring score accuracy.
